properties.entry: Sets a file as reference video file. This is only used to default the name of created files.
Read japanese subtitles from file. If not specified files with the same name of video file and of supported text subtitle type are searched.
Read translated subtitles from file. If not specified files with the same name of video file and of supported text subtitle type are searched.
Enable or disable translated subtitles in the output
Enable or disable romaji transctiption in subtitles
Enable or disable by word translation in subtitles. Currently this is supported only when using http://nihongo.j-talk.com as a source
Enable or disable furigana text in subtitles. If disabled while also kanji is disabled, convert all text in romaji
Enable or disable kanji text in subtitles. If disabled and furigana is enabled, convert all kanji in hiragana.
Sets language (two letter ISO code) as language used for translation. By default reads it from the translated subtitle file.
Creates a text-only transcript of Japanese subtitles. May be useful to review them, or to use it as an input to http://nihongo.j-talk.com
File name for CSS file used to style subtitles. If not found it is created automatically.
File name for IDX file of IDX/SUB subtitles
Writes HTML intermediate files in directory
Writes BDN/XML intermediate files in directory
Command to execute wkhtmltoimage program
Height of the generated subtitles pictures
Width of the generated subtitles pictures
Amount of milliseconds of difference in time to consider two subtitle lines the same
Amount of milliseconds of difference in time to consider two subtitle lines approximately the same
Select a subset of subtitle lines from japanese subtitles, useful for sampling
Uses specified JMdict dictionary file, defaults to JMdict_e.gz in easyjasub home directory.
easyjasub home directory, where user configuration files are located, defaults to ~/.easyjasub on Unix and %APPDATA%\easyjasub on Windows.
Name of the font to be used in CSS to style Japanese text
Suppresses output messages
More verbose output messages
Displays help
